meanings.definition: To be in a state of confusion or agitation.
meanings.sent1: The children were pothering around the room, unable to decide on a game to play.
meanings.sent2: She found herself pothering over which outfit to wear to the party.
meanings.sent3: The pothering squirrels in the park were chasing each other in circles.
meanings.sent4: The pothering thoughts in his mind made it hard to focus on his work.
meanings.sent5: The pothering wind whipped through the trees, causing leaves to swirl in all directions.

meanings.definition: To cause a commotion or disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door was pothering the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The construction work outside was pothering the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: The barking dog was pothering the sleeping cat on the porch.
meanings.sent4: Her sudden outburst pothered the otherwise calm meeting.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected arrival of the guests pothered the host who was not prepared for visitors.
